intro: Picramnia fessonia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf picramnia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, often spiny stems and small, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming during the summer months.
